New Records: Nikola Jokic had 30 points, 14 assists and 11 rebounds for his third straight triple-double, setting an NBA-best fifth of the season.
Jamal Murray became the first player in Nuggets franchise history with 1,000 career 3-pointers.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 35 points, 15 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Denver raced out to a 17-6 lead in the opening 4:10 as part of a 40-point first quarter in which it made 14 of its 20 shots.
Though it fought back to get within seven in the final five minutes of the game, Miami never led and trailed by as many as 26 in the second half.
After carrying an 11-point lead into halftime, the Nuggets outscored the Heat 15-4 in the opening 3:03 of the third quarter to extend its advantage to 86-64.
Pre-Game Insights: Jimmy Butler turned his ankle on a drive against Murray seven minutes into the game and did not return.
Denver continued its recent surge, winning for the sixth time in the past seven games after an 0-2 start.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic's performance was praised as a key factor in the win.
Jamal Murray's achievement of 1,000 career 3-pointers was highlighted.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tyler Herro had a team-high 24 points and 11 assists for the Heat.
